content.body: sideshowbarker: Domenic: if you could look at https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1004 at least up until line 2100 that'd be terrific
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: Domenic: if you could look at https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1004 at least up until line 2100 that'd be terrific

content.body: Thanks sideshowbarker. To be clear though, I was thinking of aligning more prose with this new model if it looks good. There's actually quite a lot of text is impacted.
content.formatted_body: Thanks sideshowbarker. To be clear though, I was thinking of aligning more prose with this new model if it looks good. There's actually quite a lot of text is impacted.

content.body: annevk: so you want suggestions on what else needs to be changed?
content.formatted_body: annevk: so you want suggestions on what else needs to be changed?

content.body: sideshowbarker: no, just if this direction looks good as a thing to expand upon; I can find the rest :-)
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: no, just if this direction looks good as a thing to expand upon; I can find the rest :-)

content.body: OK, I think in general it’s definitely an improvement
I am as usual more interested in the use case of web developers reading the spec than I am for implementors
as far as implementors, I get the impression that the existing spec works well overall for anybody implementing/writing code from it
* as far as implementors, I get the impression that the existing spec works well overall for anybody implementing/writing code from it

m.new_content.body: as far as implementors, I get the impression that the existing spec works well overall for anybody implementing/writing code from it

content.body: but I think it’s a lot harder for developers to learn from
Apparently jsdom ran into issues with "is a Text node" not clearly including CDATASection nodes
OK, yeah, I wondered who would actually be implementing these parts at this point
You don't really want to say Text or CDATASection however as otherwise you also need to say Element or HTMLAnchorElement or ... It gets tricky quickly
Anyway, I hope that depending on CharacterData in a number of cases will make that more clear, as well as more clearly explaining what X node is.
